recipes.name: Penne with Vodka Sauce and Mini Meatballs
recipes.instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook as the label directs. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking water, then drain.
2. Mix the beef, 1/4 cup parmesan, breadcrumbs, egg, 1/2 cup basil, minced garlic and 1/2 teaspoon salt until just combined. Form into 3/4-inch meatballs.
3. Grate the tomatoes into a medium bowl; discard the skins.
4. Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet, add meatballs. Cook until browned, 2-3 minutes.
5. Add sliced garlic, cook 1 minute. Add vodka, grated tomatoes and cream. Simmer until sauce thickens and meatballs are cooked, 8-10 minutes.
6. Season with salt and pepper.
7. Add pasta and remaining basil; toss with reserved cooking water as needed.
8. Remove from heat, add remaining parmesan and toss.
recipes.image: recipe images/Penne with Vodka Sauce and Mini Meatballs.webp

recipes.name: Shredded, Saucy BBQ Chicken Sammies
ingredients: 6-8 slices sweet bread and butter pickles, chopped
recipes.instructions:
1. Bring chicken stock and beer to a simmer in a small to medium skillet. Add chicken breast and poach for 10 minutes, turning once halfway through.
2. Meanwhile, heat another medium skillet over medium-low heat. Add olive oil, garlic, and onion; sauté gently.
3. In a medium bowl, combine Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, grill seasoning, brown sugar, and tomato paste.
4. When chicken is cooked, add 2 ladles of cooking liquid to the sauce mixture and combine.
5. Remove chicken, slice it, and transfer to the bowl with sauce. Shred using two forks and mix with sauce.
6. Add shredded chicken mixture to the onions and garlic; combine well. Simmer 5-10 minutes, adding extra cooking liquid for desired sauciness.
7. Combine sour and sweet pickles in a small bowl.
8. Split rolls and fill with scoops of shredded chicken. Top with pickle relish and serve.
recipes.image: recipe images/Shredded, Saucy BBQ Chicken Sammies.jpg

recipes.name: Tuscan Chicken Skillet
recipes.instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook fettuccine according to package directions; drain.
2. Put bacon in a large, cold skillet, cook over medium-high heat until crispy, about 8 minutes; transfer to a plate.
3. Season chicken with salt and pepper, add to skillet in single layer. Cook until golden brown, 2-3 minutes per side, then cook 4 minutes more until done. Transfer to plate with bacon.
4. Reduce heat to medium, add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
5. Add tomatoes and cream, bring to simmer. Add spinach and stir until wilted.
6. Add bacon, chicken, fettuccine and Parmesan; toss until well coated. Season with salt and pepper.
7. Sprinkle with basil and serve.

recipes.name: Chicken, Florentine Style
ingredients: 20 ounces frozen cut-leaf spinach, thawed and drained
recipes.instructions:
1. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour, shaking off excess.
2. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken until brown, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer to plate and tent with foil.
3. In same skillet, melt 2 tablespoons butter. Add shallots and garlic, sauté until shallots are translucent, about 1 minute, scraping up browned bits.
4. Add wine, increase heat to medium-high and boil until reduced by half, about 3 minutes.
5. Add cream and boil until sauce reduces by half, stirring often, about 3 minutes. Stir in parsley and season with salt and pepper.
6. Add chicken and accumulated juices to sauce, turning to coat.
7. In another skillet, melt remaining butter. Add spinach and sauté until heated through. Season with salt and pepper.
8. Arrange spinach on platter, place chicken on top, and pour sauce over. Serve.

recipes.name: Sheet Pan Chicken Shawarma
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
2. In a large bowl, combine olive oil, cumin, cinnamon, allspice, cardamom, turmeric, garlic, 2 teaspoons salt and pepper.
3. Add chicken (sliced into 1-inch pieces) and onions (sliced into 1-inch half-moons); toss to coat evenly.
4. Spread in single layer on sheet pan, ensuring pieces don't overlap.
5. Bake until chicken is cooked through and onions are slightly caramelized, about 15 minutes.
6. Meanwhile, mix yogurt, lemon juice and pepper in a medium bowl until smooth.
7. Warm pitas in microwave, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
8. Assemble: spread yogurt sauce on pitas, top with chicken and onions, then add pickles, tomatoes and lettuce.

recipes.name: Orecchiette with Greens, Garbanzo Beans and Ricotta Salata
ingredients: 1 pound orecchiette or other short pasta
12 ounces Swiss chard or mustard greens, stemmed
1 (15-ounce) can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained
2 cups small cherry or grape tomatoes
recipes.instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the pasta and cook until tender but still firm to the bite, stirring occasionally, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and reserve about 1 cup of the pasta water.
2. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant and lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove the garlic and discard.
3. Add the Swiss chard and cook until wilted. In batches, add the spinach and cook until wilted.
4. Add the beans and tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
5. Turn off the heat. Add the pasta, 1/2 of the cheese, and lemon zest.
6. Toss well and thin out the sauce with a little pasta water, if needed.
7. Transfer to a large serving bowl and season with salt and pepper.
8. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and serve.
recipes.image: recipe images/Orecchiette with Greens, Garbanzo Beans and Ricotta Salata.jpeg

recipes.name: Chicken Katsu
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 boneless skinless chicken breasts, butterflied and cut into 4 cutlets
recipes.instructions:
1. For the katsu sauce: Stir together the ketchup, Worcestershire and soy sauce in a small bowl. Set aside.
2. For the chicken: Set a wire rack in a baking sheet or line a large plate with a paper towel and set aside.
3. Place the flour, eggs and panko into 3 separate large shallow bowls.
4. Stir together 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl and then sprinkle the mixture on both sides of the cutlets.
5. Working with 1 cutlet at a time, dredge it in the flour, dip it into the eggs, and then coat it with the panko, gently pressing both sides into the panko to make sure it adheres well.
6. Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat until it reaches about 350 degrees F on a deep-fry thermometer. (To test for readiness, sprinkle a few pieces of panko into the oil. It should bubble vigorously.)
7. Working with 2 cutlets at a time to prevent crowding, cook the chicken until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side.
8. Transfer to the prepared wire rack or plate, season with salt and let rest for 2 minutes.
9. Slice each cutlet crosswise into 1/2-inch strips, lay on a bed of sliced cabbage and serve with the katsu sauce, rice and a lemon wedge.

Note: These cutlets can be frozen for make-ahead meals. Cook but don't slice them, let cool completely, then freeze in a plastic bag with parchment paper between pieces. They will keep for up to 3 months. Reheat in a 350 degree F oven until heated through and crispy, about 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Instant Pot Salmon with Garlic Potatoes and Greens
ingredients: 1 1/4 pounds small red-skinned potatoes, halved or quartered
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
Four 5- to 6-ounce skin-on center-cut salmon fillets (3/4 to 1 inch thick)
1/2 teaspoon grated lemon zest, plus lemon wedges for serving
4 cups packed mixed baby spinach and arugula (about 3 1/2 ounces)
recipes.instructions:
1. Put the potatoes in the bottom of an Instant Pot. Add 1 cup water, 2 tablespoons of the butter, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Place the pot's steam rack over the potatoes.
2. Rub the top and sides of the salmon fillets with the paprika and lemon zest and season generously with salt and pepper. Place skin-side down on the rack.
3. Put on the lid, making sure the steam valve is in the sealing position, and set the cooker to high pressure for 3 minutes.
4. When finished, carefully turn the steam valve to the venting position to release the pressure.
5. Remove the salmon and rack and set the cooker to saute at normal heat.
6. When the potatoes start sizzling, add the garlic and cook, stirring, until softened, 1 to 2 minutes; stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and season generously with salt and pepper.
7. Smash the potatoes with a fork or wooden spoon until chunky.
8. Turn off the cooker. Add the mixed greens to the potatoes and stir until wilted, 1 to 2 minutes.
9. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the salmon and potato mixture among plates. Serve with lemon wedges.
recipes.image: recipe images/Instant Pot Salmon with Garlic Potatoes and Greens.jpeg

recipes.name: Skillet Hamburger Stroganoff
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 (10-ounce) package white mushrooms, halved or quartered, if large
1 carrot, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch dice, 1 cup
2 cups (6-ounces) calcium and fiber enriched penne pasta
1/4 cup (2 ounces) 1/3 less fat cream cheese, room temperature
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef, season to taste with salt and pepper and cook, breaking into small pieces with a wooden spoon, until well browned, about 5 minutes. Transfer the meat to a bowl, leaving behind any drippings; reduce the heat to medium.
2. To the same skillet, add the mushrooms, season with salt and cook until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the cooked mushrooms to the bowl with the beef.
3. Add the oil, onion, carrot, garlic, and paprika to the skillet and continue to cook until the carrots are soft and the onion is lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
4. Stir in the tomato paste and cook until the tomato paste has toasted and is evenly coating the vegetables, 2 to 3 minutes.
5. Add the broth, water, and the Worcestershire sauce to the skillet. Bring to a simmer and stir in the pasta.
6. Cover and cook according to package directions until the noodles are just al dente.
7. Uncover, stir in the reserved beef and mushrooms until heated through.
8. Remove from heat and stir in the cream cheese, sour cream, chopped parsley, chopped chives, and salt and pepper, to taste, until the cream cheese melts and the sauce is creamy.
9. Divide among 6 bowls. Serve.

recipes.name: Quinoa Bowl with Chicken and Avocado Cream
ingredients: 1 cup fresh cilantro leaves and tender stems, finely chopped, plus 4 sprigs for garnish
1 firm-ripe avocado, halved, pitted and cut into large chunks
Juice of 1 lime, plus 1 lime, quartered
2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken meat (from about 1/2 chicken; about 3/4 pound)
1 cup store-bought or homemade black bean salsa
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the quinoa: Bring the quinoa and 2 1/2 cups water to a boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cover, reduce the heat to medium-low and gently simmer until the quinoa is tender (the little tails will pop out) and most of the water is absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Drain off any excess water. Stir in the chopped cilantro, scallions, oil and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Note: The quinoa can be cooked, cooled and refrigerated, covered, for up to 2 days. Microwave just enough to take the chill off, about 2 minutes, stirring about halfway through.

2. Make the avocado cream: While the quinoa cooks, process or blend the avocado, sour cream, Parmesan, lime juice, 1 tablespoon water, cayenne and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a food processor or blender until smooth and creamy.

3. If the corn still has a chill, microwave it for about 1 minute.

4. Build the bowls: Divide the quinoa evenly among 4 bowls. Top each with neat piles and/or rows of chicken, tortilla chips, corn, salsa and pepitas. Top with some sauce, a sprig of cilantro and a lime quarter.
recipes.image: recipe images/Quinoa Bowl with Chicken and Avocado Cream.jpg

recipes.name: Green Goddess Salmon Bowl
ingredients: 1 teaspoon lemon zest plus 1/4 cup lemon juice
1 1/2 cups pearled farro, rinsed and drained
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 1/2 pounds skin-off center-cut salmon, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 delicata squash (about 1 pound), seeded and sliced about 1/4 inch thick
recipes.instructions:
1. Place a rimmed baking sheet in the oven and preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.

2. For the green goddess dressing: Add the basil, dill, parsley, yogurt, chives, mayonnaise, lemon zest and juice, vinegar, capers, sugar, garlic, anchovy and 3/4 teaspoon salt to a blender. Puree until smooth, stopping and scraping down the sides with a spatula as needed.

3. Add the kale and 1/4 cup of the dressing to a large bowl and massage the kale until well dressed. Refrigerate both the dressed kale and remaining dressing until ready to serve.

4. For the farro: Bring the broth to a boil in a medium pot over medium-high heat. Stir in the farro, 1/2 teaspoon salt and few cracks of pepper. Cover, lower the heat to a simmer and cook until the farro is tender and has absorbed the liquid, about 25 minutes (or cook according to package instructions). Reserve the pot off heat until ready to serve.

5. For the salmon and squash: Mix together the garlic powder, mustard powder, cayenne, paprika and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt in a small bowl.

6. Toss together the salmon, 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and half of the seasoning mixture in a medium bowl. Toss together the squash, remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and remaining seasoning mixture in a second medium bowl.

7. Remove the rimmed baking sheet carefully from the oven and add the salmon to one side and the squash to the other side in a single layer. Cook, tossing halfway through, until the salmon is cooked to medium, 10 to 15 minutes (cook shorter or longer for preferred doneness).

8. Stir the cashews and parsley into the farro and divide among 4 serving bowls.

9. Divide the salmon, squash and kale among the bowls and drizzle or spoon over the green goddess dressing (or serve on the side). Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing.

recipes.name: Cracked Pepper Potato Chips with Onion Dip
ingredients: 3 large russet potatoes (2 1/4 pounds total) sliced into 1/8-inch thick rounds
2 scallions, thinly sliced, greens and whites separated
1 1/4 cups nonfat Greek style yogurt (or 1 2/3 cups regular nonfat plain yogurt)
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the chips:
   - Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
   - Toss potato slices in a large bowl with 2 tablespoons of oil and pepper until well coated.
   - Arrange potato slices in 1 layer on 2 cookie sheets.
   - Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until chips are crisped and lightly browned.
   - Remove from oven, season with salt and cool.

2. Make the dip:
   - Heat oil over medium heat and add onions and scallion whites.
   - Cook, stirring often, until golden brown and soft, about 10 minutes.
   - Remove from heat and allow to cool.

Note: If using regular yogurt, place it in a strainer lined with a paper towel and set the strainer over a bowl. Let the yogurt drain and thicken for 20 minutes.

3. Finish the dip:
   - Combine cooled onions with thickened or Greek-style yogurt, mayonnaise, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper and scallion greens.
   - Stir well to incorporate.
   - Chill for 1 hour to let flavors meld.

4. Serve the chips with the dip.
recipes.image: recipe images/Cracked Pepper Potato Chips with Onion Dip.jpeg

recipes.name: Spiced Edamame
ingredients: 1 (1-pound) bag frozen edamame, in the pod (green soy beans)
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat the salt, chili powder, and pepper flakes in a small dry skillet over medium heat, stirring until hot and aromatic, about 3 minutes.

2. Remove from the heat and crumble in the oregano.

3. Boil the edamame pods in salted water until tender, about 8 minutes.

4. Drain in a colander and pat dry.

5. Toss the edamame pods with the chili-salt mixture and serve warm.

recipes.name: Crabmeat Stuffed Mushrooms
ingredients: 12 tablespoons (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature
Finely grated zest and juice of 1 lemon
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the garlic butter:
   - Pulse the garlic in a food processor until chopped.
   - Add the butter, lemon zest, lemon juice, parsley, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.
   - Pulse until smooth.
   - Chill at least 30 minutes.

2. Prepare the mushrooms:
   - Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
   - Toss the mushrooms with 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt.
   - Fill each mushroom with 1 heaping teaspoon of the garlic butter (reserve the remaining garlic butter for the crab filling).
   - Arrange the mushrooms snugly in a baking dish.
   - Bake until tender, about 15 minutes.

3. Meanwhile, prepare the crab filling:
   - Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
   - Add the shallot and crabmeat; cook until the shallot is soft, about 3 minutes.
   - Stir in the wine and cook until slightly reduced, about 1 minute.
   - Stir in the reserved garlic butter (about 1/3 cup) until melted.
   - Season with salt and pepper.
   - Remove from the heat and push the crab mixture to one side of the skillet; let any excess juices collect.

4. Finish and broil:
   - Remove the mushrooms from the oven and preheat the broiler.
   - Stuff the mushrooms with the crab mixture.
   - Toss the panko with the juices in the skillet; sprinkle over the mushrooms.
   - Broil until golden, about 2 minutes.
   - Squeeze lemon wedges on top before serving.

recipes.name: Healthy Lasagna with Kale and Portobello Mushroom
ingredients: 1 cup coarsely chopped drained jarred roasted red peppers
One 28-ounce can no-salt-added whole plum tomatoes
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
4 portobello mushrooms, stems discarded, caps sliced 1/4-inch thick
1 small bunch kale, stems discarded, leaves coarsely chopped
9 sheets no-boil lasagna noodles, such as Barilla
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.

2. Make the sauce:
   - Puree the peppers, oregano, tomatoes, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper and sugar in a food processor or blender until smooth.
   - Set aside.

3. Prepare the cheese mixture:
   - Mix 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese with the egg whites and ricotta cheese in a medium bowl.

4. Cook the vegetables:
   - Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
   - Add sliced mushrooms and cook, stirring, until they release their liquid and are tender, about 10 minutes.
   - Stir in the kale in batches.
   - As kale wilts, add pepper flakes, garlic and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
   - Continue cooking until kale is wilted and bright green, about 5 minutes more.

5. Assemble the lasagna:
   - Mist a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
   - Spread 3/4 cup sauce in the bottom of the dish.
   - Layer: 3 noodles, 1/2 ricotta mixture, 1/2 mushroom mixture.
   - Repeat layers with sauce, noodles, remaining ricotta and mushrooms.
   - Top with remaining noodles and sauce.

6. Bake:
   - Cover with aluminum foil.
   - Bake until noodles are tender and sauce is bubbling, about 50 minutes.
   - Uncover, sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella.
   - Bake until cheese melts, about 5 minutes more.

7. Let stand 15 minutes, sprinkle with parsley and serve.
recipes.image: recipe images/Healthy Lasagna with Kale and Portobello Mushroom.jpg

recipes.name: Pasta, Kale and White Bean Soup
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
1/2 cup grated parmesan, plus 1 small piece rind
1 1/2 cups small pasta, such as ditalini (about 8 ounces)
1 15-ounce can white beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup frozen chopped kale, thawed and squeezed dry
recipes.instructions:
1. Cook the bacon:
   - Put bacon in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
   - Cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp, about 4 minutes.

2. Cook the vegetables:
   - Add onion and cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes.
   - Add carrots, garlic, tomato paste, thyme, and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper.
   - Cook until carrots begin to soften, about 2 minutes.

3. Make the soup base:
   - Add chicken broth, 6 cups water and the parmesan rind.
   - Increase heat to high; cover and bring to a boil.

4. Cook pasta and add ingredients:
   - Add pasta and beans and cook, uncovered, 5 minutes.
   - Reduce heat to medium and add kale.
   - Simmer, uncovered, until slightly thickened, about 7 minutes.

5. Finish and serve:
   - Remove parmesan rind.
   - Stir in half of the grated cheese.
   - Season with salt and pepper.
   - Ladle into bowls and top with remaining cheese.
recipes.image: recipe images/Pasta, Kale and White Bean Soup.jpg

recipes.name: Kale and Tomato Eggs Benedict
ingredients: 2 ounces Canadian bacon, cut into small chunks
8 cups petite kale or baby spinach
1 large ripe tomato, cut into 4 slices
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the Hollandaise sauce:
   - Combine mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon warm water, mustard, lemon juice and cayenne pepper in a blender.
   - Process until combined.
   - Scrape out and set aside.

2. Prepare poaching liquid:
   - Fill a wide pot with about 3 inches of water.
   - Add vinegar and bring to a low simmer.

3. Cook bacon and vegetables:
   - Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet.
   - Add Canadian bacon and shallots.
   - Cook, stirring frequently, until golden, about 4 minutes.
   - Add kale, remove from heat.
   - Stir until kale wilts, about 2 minutes.
   - Season with pepper.
   - Set aside and keep warm.

4. Prepare English muffins:
   - Toast muffins until lightly golden, about 5 minutes.
   - Top each with a tomato slice.
   - Toast until tomato is just slightly warm, about 1 minute.
   - Top each muffin with the Canadian bacon-kale mixture.

5. Poach eggs:
   - Crack each egg into a mug.
   - Slip into the simmering water.
   - Cook until whites are at desired doneness, 3 to 5 minutes.
   - Remove with a slotted spoon.
   - Place on each Benedict.

6. Finish and serve:
   - Drizzle with Hollandaise sauce.
   - Serve immediately.
recipes.image: recipe images/Kale and Tomato Eggs Benedict.jpeg

recipes.name: High-Protein Cottage Cheese Pancakes
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, for the skillet
recipes.instructions:
1. Grind the oats in a blender, stopping and shaking the carafe as needed for even grinding, until a mostly fine powder.

2. Add ingredients to blender in this order:
   - Eggs
   - Cottage cheese
   - Bananas
   - Peanut butter powder
   - Maple syrup
   - Baking powder
   - Cinnamon
   - Vanilla

3. Puree, stopping and stirring as needed, until well blended, about 30 seconds total.

4. Transfer the batter to a bowl and stir in the chocolate chips.

5. Melt about 1 teaspoon of butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat and spread it around with a spatula.

6. Ladle 1/4-cup mounds of batter spaced apart in the skillet. Spread the pancakes out with the back of a spoon if too thick.

7. Cook until browned underneath, 3 to 4 minutes, then flip and brown the other side, 3 to 4 minutes.

8. Repeat with remaining batter and butter, wiping out the skillet with a paper towel after each batch.

Storage Note: For meal prep, freeze pancakes in a single layer, then transfer to a resealable plastic bag. Store in freezer for up to 2 months. Reheat individual pancakes in microwave or toaster oven.

recipes.name: Ejjeh with Potatoes
ingredients: 1 pound Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and chopped
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the potatoes:
   - Place the potatoes and 1 teaspoon of the salt in a pot and cover with cold water.
   - Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to medium.
   - Cook until the potatoes are fork-tender, 20 to 25 minutes.
   - Drain the potatoes, then return them to the pot.
   - Add the lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper.
   - Use a potato masher to mash them.
   - Set aside.

2. Prepare the egg mixture:
   - In a large bowl, whisk together:
     - Eggs
     - Parsley
     - Green onions
     - Flour
     - Remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt
     - Remaining 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
   - Whisk until well combined.

3. Cook the omelets:
   - Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a 6-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat.
   - Measure out 1/2 cup of the omelet mixture and pour it into the heated skillet.
   - Cook until the eggs are set and golden brown on the bottom, about 2 minutes.
   - Flip and cook the other side for an additional 1 minute.
   - Transfer the omelet to a cooling rack.
   - Continue with the remaining oil and batter, making 8 omelets.

4. Assemble and serve:
   - Divide the mashed potatoes between the 8 omelets (about 1/2 cup in each).
   - Place the potatoes in the middle of each omelet.
   - Roll up the omelets to enclose the potatoes.
   - Stack them on a plate to serve.
   - Enjoy immediately.

Cook's Notes:
- Use a nonstick pan to maintain a flatbread-like consistency and make flipping easier.
- Whisk the mixture very well to ensure smooth texture and even taste.
- Chop the greens evenly and small for best flavor and texture.
- You can substitute different onions and herbs as desired.

recipes.name: Veggie-Packed Breakfast Frittata
ingredients: 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes (not packed in oil), chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.

2. Heat the oil in a medium oven-safe nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
   - Add the bell peppers and onion.
   - Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 6 to 7 minutes.

3. Add the spinach, sun-dried tomatoes and garlic.
   - Cook, stirring frequently, until the spinach is just wilted and still vibrant green, about 1 minute.

4. Reduce the heat to low and add the eggs, 1 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of black pepper.
   - Stir gently to distribute the vegetables.

5. Bake until the eggs are set, 13 to 15 minutes.

6. Let stand for 5 minutes, then slice into 6 pieces.
   - Serve with hot sauce.
   - Refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

recipes.name: No-Cook Blueberry-Almond Oatmeal
recipes.instructions:
1. The night before:
   - Combine the milk, oats, blueberries, brown sugar, lemon zest, vanilla, almond extract and a pinch of salt in a glass pint jar or other container with a lid.
   - Secure the lid and shake.
   - Refrigerate at least 6 hours up to overnight.

2. In the morning:
   - Top with the almonds.
   - Drizzle with honey or agave nectar.
   - Serve and enjoy.

recipes.name: Avocado Toast with Smoked Salmon
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the avocado:
   - Halve, pit and scoop the avocado out into a shallow bowl.
   - Mash with a fork until chunky.
   - Season with salt and pepper.

2. Prepare the toast:
   - Toast the bread.
   - Lightly rub each slice with the cut side of the garlic clove.
   - Brush each slice with some oil.

3. Assemble and serve:
   - Divide and spread the mashed avocado evenly among the toasts.
   - Lay a piece of smoked salmon over the avocado.
   - Top with a pinch of flaky sea salt, a few grinds of pepper and some dill.
   - Serve with lemon wedges on the side.
recipes.image: recipe images/Avocado Toast with Smoked Salmon.jpg

recipes.name: Banana and Walnut Smoothie
ingredients: 2 dried dates, pitted and coarsely chopped
recipes.instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a blender:
   - Ice
   - Almond milk
   - Coconut water
   - Walnut pieces
   - Dried dates
   - Banana

2. Blend on high speed until smooth.

3. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Saucy Tofu and Mushrooms Over Rice
ingredients: 2 cups low-sodium vegetable broth or water
2 tablespoons coarse gochugaru (Korean red chile flakes)
2 teaspoons chili-garlic sauce, such as sambal oelek
1/4 cup fresh parsley leaves, finely chopped
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the tofu and mushrooms:
   - Quarter the tofu lengthwise, then slice into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Set aside.
   - Trim off any tough woody ends from the mushrooms.
   - Slice into 1/2-inch-thick pieces.

2. Cook the mushrooms:
   - Heat a large high-sided skillet over medium heat until hot, about 3 minutes.
   - Add the mushrooms, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 cup cold water.
   - Cover and cook until the mushrooms have shrunk a bit, about 3 minutes.
   - Uncover and cook until the liquid evaporates.
   - Add 1 tablespoon of the oil and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are golden brown, 4 to 6 minutes.
   - Transfer to a plate; set aside.

3. Make the sauce:
   - Set the same skillet over low heat.
   - Add the shallots and remaining 1 tablespoon oil.
   - Cook until the shallots are translucent, about 2 minutes.
   - Stir in the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
   - Stir in the tomato paste and cook until darkened, about 3 minutes.
   - Turn off the heat, add the vodka and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom.
   - Turn the heat to medium and cook until the vodka reduces almost completely, about 1 minute.
   - Whisk in the vegetable broth, coconut milk, gochugaru, chili-garlic sauce, miso, sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt until completely smooth.

4. Combine and finish:
   - Gently stir in the tofu slices and mushrooms until coated.
   - Bring the sauce to a gentle simmer.
   - Cook until it darkens and slightly thickens, 2 to 4 minutes.
   - Gently stir in the parsley and red wine vinegar.

5. Serve:
   - Divide the saucy tofu and mushrooms among 4 plates with steamed rice.

Cook's Note:
There are two kinds of gochugaru in Korean grocery stores. Make sure to buy a coarser version of gochugaru, as it is mainly used for kimchi making. Finer gochugaru is more widely used for soups, gochujang (Korean red chile paste) and side dishes.
recipes.image: recipe images/Saucy Tofu and Mushrooms Over Rice.jpeg

recipes.name: One-Pot Lemon Ricotta Spaghettoni
ingredients: 1 bunch scallions, whites and greens thinly sliced and separated
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the base:
   - Heat the olive oil in a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat.
   - Add the scallion whites, 1 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of black pepper.
   - Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and starting to caramelize, 3 to 4 minutes.
   - Add the oregano, crushed red pepper flakes and garlic.
   - Cook, stirring, until the garlic is softened and fragrant, about 1 minute.

2. Cook the pasta:
   - Add the lemon juice, 5 1/2 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of black pepper to the pot.
   - Scrape up any brown bits from the bottom.
   - Add the spaghettoni and spread it out as much as possible.
   - Bring the water to a boil.
   - Cook, stirring frequently to prevent sticking, until:
     * Pasta is al dente
     * Mixture is creamy and starchy
     * Almost all water has evaporated
     * About 10 to 12 minutes total

3. Finish and serve:
   - Turn off the heat.
   - Stir in the Parmesan, ricotta and lemon zest.
   - Continue stirring until cheeses have melted and sauce is very creamy, about 1 minute.
   - Divide pasta into 4 bowls.
   - Garnish each with scallion greens and a few more cracks of black pepper.

recipes.name: Sweet Potato Toast with Steak, Roasted Peppers and Arugula
ingredients: 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
3 ounces deli-sliced roasted red bell peppers, drained (about 1/3 cup)
4 ounces cooked sirloin or skirt steak, thinly sliced
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.

2. Prepare sweet potatoes:
   - Slice off the 4 long sides of each sweet potato so they are squared off and sit flat.
   - Slice potatoes lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick planks (about 5-inches-by-2-inches).
   - You should get 3 planks per sweet potato.

3. Season and roast:
   - Combine sweet potatoes, olive oil and a pinch of salt in a medium bowl.
   - Toss gently to coat.
   - Spread on a baking sheet.
   - Roast, flipping halfway through, until lightly browned and tender when pierced, about 15 minutes.
   - Remove to 2 plates.

4. Assemble and serve:
   - Divide peppers among the toasts.
   - Top with steak slices.
   - Toss arugula with a drizzle of olive oil and dash of hot sauce.
   - Distribute dressed arugula over the steak.
   - Season each toast with salt and black pepper.
   - Serve immediately.

Cook's Note:
You can make the toasts in advance and refrigerate them in an airtight container up to 4 days. Reheat in a toaster until warmed through.
recipes.image: recipe images/Sweet Potato Toast with Steak, Roasted Peppers and Arugula.jpeg

recipes.name: Antipasti Penne
ingredients: 3 ounces soppressata or salami, cut into 1/2-inch chunks
One 14-ounce can artichoke hearts, strained and quartered
6 stuffed Spanish queen olives, halved, plus 2 tablespoons brine
4 to 5 fresh basil leaves, plus more for garnish
recipes.instructions:
1. Cook the pasta:
   - Bring a medium pot of water to a boil.
   - Add the pasta and cook according to package instructions.
   - Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the pasta water.
   - Return the pasta to the pot.

2. Prepare the sauce:
   - Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
   - Add soppressata and cook, stirring, until blistered and oil turns reddish, about 3 minutes.
   - Add artichoke hearts and olives; stir to coat.
   - Add tomatoes, reserved pasta water, basil leaves and 2 tablespoons olive brine.
   - Bring to a simmer and cook until most water evaporates and sauce thickens, 8 to 10 minutes.

3. Finish and serve:
   - Add the sauce and mozzarella to the pasta in the pot.
   - Stir to combine.
   - Divide among 4 bowls.
   - Garnish with additional basil.

recipes.name: Mexican Chicken Stew
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
   - Add onion and saute for 1 to 2 minutes.
   - Add garlic and jalapeno.
   - Sweat until soft and translucent.

2. Add seasonings and tomatoes:
   - Add oregano and cumin.
   - Cook for 1 to 2 minutes until fragrant and aromatic.
   - Add tomatoes, chicken, Worcestershire sauce, and stock.

3. Simmer:
   - Bring to a simmer.
   - Cook for 20 minutes.

4. Finish and serve:
   - Cut lime in half and squeeze juice into the pot.
   - Add the juiced lime halves to the pot.
   - Add white rice and cook 5 minutes longer to warm rice through.
   - Season with salt to taste.
   - Ladle into bowls.
   - Garnish with sour cream and cilantro leaves.

recipes.name: Keto Tuna Salad Cups
ingredients: 1/3 cup olive or avocado oil mayonnaise
1/4 teaspoon lemon zest plus 1 tablespoon lemon juice
Two 5-ounce cans tuna packed in olive oil, 2 tablespoons of the oil reserved and the rest drained
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 medium tomato, halved and cut into 8 slices
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the eggs:
   - Cover eggs with about an inch of water in a medium pot.
   - Bring to a boil, remove from heat, cover and let stand for 8 minutes.
   - Drain and submerge in ice water.
   - When cool enough to handle, peel and chop.

2. Cook the bacon:
   - Cook bacon in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until golden and crisp, about 4 minutes per side.
   - Remove to a paper towel-lined plate.
   - Crumble into bite-size pieces.

3. Make the tuna salad:
   - In a medium bowl, whisk together:
     * Mayonnaise
     * Sour cream
     * Lemon zest and juice
     * Celery
     * Reserved tuna oil
     * Three-quarters of the scallions
     * 1/4 teaspoon salt
     * Several grinds of pepper
   - Add tuna and three-quarters of the bacon and egg.
   - Gently fold together (do not overmix).
   - Season with additional salt and pepper if needed.

4. Prepare tomatoes:
   - Sprinkle tomato slices with salt and pepper.

5. Assemble and serve:
   - Double-up the lettuce leaves.
   - Fill each with tuna salad.
   - Tuck in a tomato slice.
   - Sprinkle with reserved scallions, bacon and egg.

recipes.name: Chipotle Veggie Burritos
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon chipotle chile powder, plus more to taste
1 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
2 cups shredded pepper jack cheese (about 8 ounces)
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the cilantro rice:
   - Puree all but 3 tablespoons cilantro with 2 cups water, garlic, chile powder and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a blender until smooth.
   - Transfer to a medium saucepan with the rice.
   - Bring to a boil.
   - Reduce heat to low; cover and cook until liquid is absorbed, about 18 minutes.
   - Uncover, stir and let cool 5 minutes.

2. Prepare the bean mixture:
   - Bring black bean soup to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium-high heat.
   - Cook until liquid is slightly reduced, about 3 minutes.
   - Stir in spinach and return to a simmer.
   - Remove from heat and cover to keep warm.

3. Make the corn salsa:
   - In a large bowl, combine:
     * Corn
     * Tomato
     * Lime juice
     * Reserved 3 tablespoons cilantro
     * 1/2 teaspoon salt
     * Chile powder to taste

4. Assemble the burritos:
   - Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
   - Divide rice, bean mixture and cheese among tortillas.
   - Top with corn salsa.
   - Fold up bottoms of tortillas, then fold in sides and roll up.
   - Serve with remaining corn salsa.

recipes.name: Broccoli Melts
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the broccoli:
   - If using broccolini, cut into 2-inch segments.
   - If using regular broccoli:
     * Peel stems with a vegetable peeler for even cooking
     * Cut the rest into large chunks

2. Cook the broccoli:
   - Pour 1-inch of salted water into a large saute pan and bring to a boil.
   - Add broccoli and cover with lid.
   - Let boil/steam for 2 minutes.
   - Drain well and pat dry on paper towels.
   - Wring out as much extra liquid as possible.
   - Chop into small (roughly 1/2-inch) bits.

3. Make the broccoli mixture:
   - Wipe saute pan dry and heat over medium.
   - Add olive oil and heat for a full minute.
   - Add garlic and pepper flakes.
   - Cook until garlic is just beginning to turn golden, about 1 minute.
   - Add broccoli and cook 1 to 2 minutes more.
   - Season with salt.
   - Transfer mixture to a bowl.
   - Add lemon zest, juice, and Pecorino.
   - Season with additional salt and pepper flakes to taste.

4. Assemble and broil:
   - Preheat broiler.
   - Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet.
   - Lightly toast bread on both sides.
   - Scoop broccoli mixture onto each slice.
   - Top each with a slice of provolone.
   - Broil until cheese has melted and begun to blister.

Note: Makes 8 servings. Can be repeated as desired, just remember to share (or hide the evidence if you don't).

recipes.name: Grilled Steak with Green Beans, Tomatoes and Chimichurri Sauce
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more for grill grates
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
2 strip steaks (about 1-inch thick), about 1 1/2 pounds total, trimmed of excess fat and halved
1/4 cup fresh herbs, such as parsley, mint and cilantro
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the vegetables:
   - Place a double layered piece of heavy-duty foil on a tray or cutting board.
   - Fold and gather edge to form a rim.
   - Toss green beans and tomatoes on foil with 1 tablespoon olive oil.
   - Season with salt and pepper.

2. Grill preparation:
   - Preheat grill to medium.
   - Lightly oil the grill grates.
   - Season the steak with salt and pepper.

3. Cook vegetables:
   - Slide the foil tray onto the grill.
   - Cook, tossing occasionally, until beans char slightly and cook through, about 15 minutes.

4. Cook steaks:
   - Add steaks to the grill while vegetables are cooking.
   - Cook until desired doneness, about 5 minutes per side for medium-rare.
   - Remove steaks to cutting board.
   - Let rest 5 minutes before slicing.

5. Make Chimichurri Sauce:
   - Combine in small food processor:
     * Garlic
     * Red wine vinegar
     * Fresh herbs
     * Olive oil
     * Water
   - Pulse until herbs are coarsely chopped.
   - Season with salt and pepper.

6. Serve:
   - Slice the steak.
   - Serve steak and vegetables with Chimichurri Sauce.
recipes.image: recipe images/Grilled Steak with Green Beans, Tomatoes and Chimichurri Sauce.jpeg

recipes.name: Herb-Marinated Pork Tenderloins
ingredients: 3/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (4 to 6 lemons)
1/2 cup plus 3 tablespoons good olive oil, divided
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the marinade:
   - Combine in a sturdy 1-gallon resealable plastic bag:
     * Lemon zest
     * Lemon juice
     * 1/2 cup olive oil
     * Garlic
     * Rosemary
     * Thyme
     * Mustard
     * 2 teaspoons salt

2. Marinate the pork:
   - Add pork tenderloins to bag.
   - Turn to coat with marinade.
   - Squeeze out air and seal bag.
   - Marinate in refrigerator at least 3 hours, preferably overnight.

3. Prepare for cooking:
   - Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
   - Remove tenderloins from marinade.
   - Discard marinade but leave herbs clinging to meat.
   - Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper.

4. Sear and roast:
   - Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in large oven-proof saute pan over medium-high heat.
   - Sear tenderloins on all sides until golden brown.
   - Transfer pan to oven.
   - Roast 10-15 minutes until meat registers 137 degrees F at thickest part.

5. Rest and serve:
   - Transfer to platter.
   - Cover tightly with aluminum foil.
   - Let rest 10 minutes.
   - Carve in 1/2-inch-thick diagonal slices.
   - Season with salt and pepper.
   - Serve warm or at room temperature with collected juices.

Note: The thickest part will be quite pink (which is fine) and the thinnest part will be well done.

recipes.name: Hoisin Turkey Burgers with Quick Pickles and Chili Garlic Yogurt
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons chopped cilantro, plus 1/4 cup whole leaves
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the bulgur:
   - Put bulgur in a medium bowl and add boiling water.
   - Cover with plastic wrap.
   - Let stand until tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour.

2. Make quick pickles:
   - In a medium bowl, whisk together:
     * Rice wine vinegar
     * Sugar
     * Salt and pepper until dissolved
   - Add cucumber and onion.
   - Toss well and marinate for about 30 minutes.

3. Make chili garlic yogurt:
   - Combine yogurt and chili garlic sauce in a small bowl.
   - Season with salt and pepper.
   - Set aside.

4. Prepare burger patties:
   - Drain the bulgur and put into a large bowl.
   - Add turkey, hoisin, scallions, ginger, garlic and chopped cilantro.
   - Mix until just combined.
   - Form into 4 equal sized patties.

5. Cook the burgers:
   - Heat large nonstick skillet over medium heat until very hot.
   - Lightly brush both sides of patties with oil.
   - Cook 3-4 minutes per side until just cooked through.

6. Assemble and serve:
   - Drain pickled vegetables.
   - Toss with whole cilantro leaves.
   - Spread spicy yogurt sauce on buns.
   - Top with burger patties and pickles.

Cook's Note: These burgers are lightened by cutting back on meat and adding bulgur for texture. Asian flavors, quick pickles, and spicy yogurt sauce combine for a delicious meal.
recipes.image: recipe images/Hoisin Turkey Burgers with Quick Pickles and Chili Garlic Yogurt.webp

recipes.name: Spicy Vegan Sloppy Joes
ingredients: 1 small green bell pepper, seeded and diced
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the mushrooms:
   - Pulse mushrooms in batches in a food processor until finely chopped.
   - Set aside.

2. Cook the vegetables:
   - Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
   - Add onions, 1 tablespoon beer and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
   - Cook, stirring frequently, until onions are lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
   - Add walnuts and peppers.
   - Cook, stirring occasionally, until peppers are crisp-tender, about 3 minutes.

3. Add mushrooms and seasonings:
   - Add mushrooms, 3/4 teaspoon black pepper and chipotle powder.
   - Cook, stirring frequently, until mushrooms are just cooked through, about 5 minutes.

4. Make the sauce:
   - Add remaining beer, ketchup, tomato paste and 1/8 teaspoon salt.
   - Cook while stirring until sauce reaches desired consistency, about 2 minutes.

5. Serve:
   - Spoon mixture onto each bun.
   - Add optional toppings if desired.

Cook's Note: Some buns are not vegan, so check the label to ensure your hamburger buns are dairy and egg free.

recipes.name: Vegan Lentil Chili
ingredients: 1 bunch scallions, thinly sliced on the diagonal, light- and dark-green parts separated
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
Two 14.5-ounce cans diced tomatoes with their juices
Two 14.5-ounce cans kidney beans, drained and rinsed
2 cups frozen diced butternut squash (from a 10-ounce bag)
1 tablespoon agave syrup or maple syrup
recipes.instructions:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large heavy-bottom pot over medium-high heat.

2. Add the light-green scallion parts, both bell peppers, 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of black pepper.
   - Cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables have softened, 5 to 6 minutes.

3. Add seasonings:
   - Add tomato paste, garlic, ancho chile powder, cumin and cinnamon.
   - Cook, stirring, until tomato paste darkens and garlic softens, about 1 minute.

4. Add liquids and lentils:
   - Add tomatoes and their juices, lentils, 2 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt and black pepper.
   - Stir to combine.
   - Bring to a boil, then reduce heat.
   - Simmer, stirring occasionally, until lentils soften, 12 to 15 minutes.

5. Add remaining ingredients:
   - Fold in kidney beans, butternut squash and agave syrup.
   - Cook, stirring once or twice, until squash is heated through, 2 to 3 minutes.

6. Serve:
   - Ladle chili into bowls.
   - Garnish as desired with radish, jalapeno, avocado, pepitas and dark-green scallion parts.

recipes.name: Vegan Pumpkin Pie
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for rolling
1/2 cup unrefined virgin or extra-virgin coconut oil (packed)
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the crust:
   - Combine flour, sugar, vinegar and 1/2 teaspoon salt in food processor.
   - Pulse to combine.
   - Add coconut oil in small spoonfuls.
   - Pulse until largest pieces are pea-sized.
   - Add 4 tablespoons ice water.
   - Pulse until evenly combined.
   - Add 1-2 tablespoons more water if needed.
   - Form into 1/2-inch-thick disc.
   - Chill for at least 1 hour.

2. Roll and form crust:
   - Let dough soften at room temperature (20-40 minutes).
   - Roll into 12-inch round on floured surface.
   - Transfer to 9-inch pie plate.
   - Fold and crimp edges.
   - Chill for 30 minutes.

3. Blind bake crust:
   - Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
   - Line crust with coffee filter or foil.
   - Fill with pie weights.
   - Bake 20-25 minutes until edges are golden.
   - Remove weights and liner.
   - Bake 15-20 minutes more until golden all over.
   - Cool completely.

4. Make the filling:
   - Process in food processor until smooth:
     * Pumpkin puree
     * Silken tofu
     * Sugar
     * Cornstarch
     * Cinnamon
     * Nutmeg
     * Vanilla
     * 1/4 teaspoon salt

5. Bake and chill:
   - Pour filling into cooled crust.
   - Bake 40-45 minutes until set.
   - Cool completely on rack.
   - Chill at least 2 hours or overnight.
   - Slice and serve.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Chicken Thighs
ingredients: 2 garlic cloves, crushed with a garlic press or minced
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the marinade:
   - Combine in a bowl:
     * Soy sauce
     * Brown sugar
     * Dry sherry
     * Rice vinegar
     * Crushed garlic
     * Grated ginger
     * Red pepper flakes
   - Stir until sugar dissolves.

2. Marinate the chicken:
   - Transfer marinade to a resealable plastic bag.
   - Add chicken thighs.
   - Seal bag and refrigerate.
   - Turn once during marination.
   - Marinate for 1 hour (can go up to 4 hours).

3. Prepare for cooking:
   - Heat broiler to high.
   - Arrange chicken on broiler pan skin side down.

4. Cook the chicken:
   - Broil until brown and crispy, 8-10 minutes.
   - Flip chicken.
   - Broil about 8 minutes longer until almost cooked through.
   - Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
   - Cook 1-2 minutes more until:
     * Seeds turn golden brown
     * Chicken is completely cooked through

recipes.name: Broiled Salmon with Herb Mustard Glaze
ingredients: 3/4 teaspoon finely chopped fresh rosemary leaves
3/4 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme leaves
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the mustard sauce:
   - In a mini food processor, combine:
     * Garlic
     * Rosemary
     * Thyme
     * Wine
     * Oil
     * Dijon mustard
     * 1 tablespoon whole-grain mustard
   - Grind until combined, about 30 seconds.
   - Transfer to small bowl.
   - Stir in remaining tablespoon whole-grain mustard.

2. Prepare for broiling:
   - Preheat broiler.
   - Line heavy rimmed baking sheet with foil.
   - Spray foil with nonstick spray.
   - Arrange salmon fillets on baking sheet.
   - Season with salt and pepper.

3. Cook the salmon:
   - Broil for 2 minutes.
   - Spoon mustard sauce over fillets.
   - Continue broiling until fillets are cooked through and golden brown, about 5 minutes longer.

4. Serve:
   - Transfer fillets to plates.
   - Serve with lemon wedges.

Cook's Note: For wine pairing, consider a 2001 Pecchenino Dolcetto from Alba, Piedmont. This lighter bodied red pairs well with the rich, silky texture of the salmon and complements the herbs in the mustard glaze.
recipes.image: recipe images/Broiled Salmon with Herb Mustard Glaze.webp

recipes.name: Oil and Vinegar Slaw
ingredients: 16 ounces shredded cabbage mix for slaw salads
recipes.instructions:
1. Make the dressing:
   - In a large bowl, combine vinegar and sugar.
   - Stir until sugar begins to dissolve.
   - Add oil and whisk to combine.

2. Prepare the slaw:
   - Add shredded cabbage mix to the bowl with dressing.
   - Season with salt and pepper.
   - Toss with fingers to combine ingredients thoroughly.
   - Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.

3. Let rest and serve:
   - Let stand for 20 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
   - Re-toss before serving.

recipes.name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.

2. Prepare Brussels sprouts:
   - Cut off brown ends
   - Pull off any yellow outer leaves
   - Mix in a bowl with olive oil, salt and pepper

3. Roast:
   - Pour onto a sheet pan
   - Roast for 35 to 40 minutes until:
     * Crisp on the outside
     * Tender on the inside
   - Shake pan occasionally to brown evenly

4. Finish and serve:
   - Sprinkle with additional kosher salt to taste
   - Serve immediately

recipes.name: Green Beans with Lemon and Garlic
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Blanch green beans:
   - Bring a large stock pot of well salted water to boil.
   - Add green beans and cook until bright green and tender crisp, about 2 minutes.
   - Drain and shock in a bowl of ice water to stop cooking.

2. Prepare the sauce:
   - Heat a large heavy skillet over medium heat.
   - Add olive oil and butter.
   - Add garlic and red pepper flakes.
   - Saute until fragrant, about 30 seconds.

3. Finish the dish:
   - Add blanched beans to the skillet.
   - Saute until coated in butter and heated through, about 5 minutes.
   - Add lemon zest.
   - Season with salt and pepper to taste.
recipes.image: recipe images/Green Beans with Lemon and Garlic.jpg

recipes.name: Healthy Air Fryer Turkey Meatballs with Zoodles
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds zoodles (spiralized zucchini noodles, from about 3 medium zucchinis)
1 tablespoon finely grated Parmesan, plus more for serving
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the zoodles:
   - Toss zoodles with salt in a large bowl.
   - Let sit for 10 minutes until softened and released excess liquid.
   - Pat dry and set aside.

2. Make the meatball mixture:
   - Combine breadcrumbs and milk in medium bowl.
   - Let sit 5 minutes until breadcrumbs soften.
   - Add turkey, ricotta, parsley, Parmesan, oregano, 1/2 teaspoon salt and pepper.
   - Mix thoroughly with hands.
   - Form into 12 meatballs (1 1/2 tablespoons each, 1 inch wide).

3. Cook the meatballs:
   - Preheat air fryer to 400 degrees F.
   - Add meatballs with space between for air circulation.
   - Air fry 10 minutes until golden brown, turning halfway.

4. Prepare sauce:
   - Warm tomato sauce in saucepan over medium heat.
   - Add cooked meatballs.
   - Reduce heat to low to keep warm.

5. Cook the zoodles:
   - Season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper.
   - Air fry at 400 degrees F for 5-6 minutes.
   - Toss halfway through until tender and edges brown.

6. Serve:
   - Divide zoodles between 2 plates.
   - Top each with 6 meatballs.
   - Spoon warm sauce over top.
   - Sprinkle with additional Parmesan.

Cook's Note: You can find prepared zoodles at some grocery stores or make your own from three 8-ounce zucchinis using a spiralizer.
recipes.image: recipe images/Healthy Air Fryer Turkey Meatballs with Zoodles.webp

recipes.name: Garlic Sauteed Spinach
recipes.instructions:
1. Clean the spinach:
   - Rinse spinach well in cold water.
   - Spin dry in salad spinner.
   - Leave just a little water clinging to leaves.

2. Prepare the garlic:
   - Heat olive oil in very large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
   - Saute garlic for about 1 minute (do not brown).

3. Cook the spinach:
   - Add spinach, salt, and pepper to pot.
   - Toss with garlic and oil.
   - Cover pot and cook for 2 minutes.
   - Uncover pot and turn heat to high.
   - Cook for 1 more minute, stirring with wooden spoon.
   - Cook until all spinach is wilted.

4. Serve:
   - Using slotted spoon, transfer spinach to serving bowl.
   - Top with butter.
   - Squeeze fresh lemon over top.
   - Sprinkle with sea or kosher salt if desired.
   - Serve hot.

recipes.name: Roasted Carrots
ingredients: 2 tablespoons minced fresh dill or parsley
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the oven:
   - Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.

2. Prepare the carrots:
   - If carrots are thick, cut them in half lengthwise.
   - If carrots are thin, leave whole.
   - Slice diagonally into 1 1/2-inch-thick slices.
   - Note: Make slices big as carrots will shrink while cooking.

3. Season and roast:
   - Toss carrots in a bowl with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
   - Transfer to a sheet pan in single layer.
   - Roast for 20 minutes until browned and tender.

4. Finish and serve:
   - Toss roasted carrots with minced dill or parsley.
   - Season to taste.
   - Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Spaghetti and No-Meat Balls
ingredients: 1 (14-ounce) package extra firm tofu, drained and crumbled
For the Simple and Quick Tomato Sauce:
1 (28-ounce) can organic plum tomatoes with juice
1 small clove garlic, peeled and crushed
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the vegetables:
   - Heat 2 tablespoons oil in medium skillet over medium heat.
   - Add onion and pinch of salt, cook until softened, 3-5 minutes.
   - Add mushrooms, garlic, and red pepper flakes.
   - Raise heat to high.
   - Cook until mushrooms release juices and caramelize, 4-5 minutes.

2. Make the no-meat ball mixture:
   - Transfer cooked vegetables to food processor.
   - Add tofu, egg and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
   - Pulse to combine.
   - Add bread crumbs and parsley.
   - Pulse again to combine.
   - Transfer to bowl and season with black pepper.

3. Form and cook the no-meat balls:
   - Spread flour on plate.
   - Form 1 1/2-inch balls with moistened hands.
   - Coat balls lightly in flour.
   - Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in large skillet.
   - Cook balls until browned, 3-4 minutes per side.

4. Make the tomato sauce:
   - Combine in food processor:
     * Plum tomatoes with juice
     * Kosher salt
     * Oregano
     * Black pepper
     * Crushed garlic
     * Basil leaves
   - Pulse to form rough puree with basil flecks.

5. Finish the dish:
   - Add tomato sauce to pan with no-meat balls.
   - Simmer until balls are firm and cooked through, about 15 minutes.
   - Serve over your favorite pasta.

recipes.name: 7-Vegetable Bolognese Sauce
ingredients: 8 ounces peeled, cubed butternut squash (about 1 1/2 cups)
1 medium carrot, peeled and roughly chopped
1/2 small red bell pepper, seeded and roughly chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
One 28-ounce can whole peeled tomatoes, crushed
1/2 cup Parmesan, plus more for serving
recipes.instructions:
1. Process the vegetables:
   - Pulse mushrooms in food processor until finely chopped; transfer to bowl.
   - Pulse together in food processor until finely chopped:
     * Butternut squash
     * Onion
     * Carrot
     * Celery
     * Bell pepper
     * Garlic
   - Transfer to bowl with mushrooms.
   - Pulse cashews separately until finely chopped; set aside.

2. Start the sauce:
   - Heat olive oil in large pot over medium-high heat.
   - Add mushroom-veggie mixture, thyme, rosemary, red pepper flakes, nutmeg.
   - Season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and black pepper.
   - Cook until vegetables release liquid and start to caramelize, about 5 minutes.
   - Add tomato paste, cook 2 minutes until darkened.
   - Add wine, cook 4 minutes until absorbed, scraping bottom of pot.

3. Simmer the sauce:
   - Add cashews, tomatoes, milk, 1/2 cup water.
   - Season with 1 teaspoon salt and black pepper.
   - Bring to boil, then reduce heat to low.
   - Cover and simmer 45-60 minutes until thickened and vegetables are tender.

4. Cook the pasta:
   - Bring large pot of salted water to boil.
   - Cook rigatoni to al dente according to package.
   - Drain well.

5. Finish and serve:
   - Stir 1/2 cup Parmesan into sauce.
   - Season to taste with salt and pepper.
   - Toss sauce with pasta.
   - Serve with additional Parmesan.

Cook's Note: Cashews add meaty texture but can be omitted for nut-free version.

recipes.name: Stuffed Honeynut Squash
ingredients: 2 pounds Honeynut squash (6 to 8), halved and seeded
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the oven:
   - Position rack in center of oven.
   - Preheat to 425 degrees F.

2. Roast the squash:
   - Toss squash with 3 tablespoons oil.
   - Season with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
   - Arrange cut-side up on rimmed baking sheet.
   - Bake 30-40 minutes until tender and browned in spots.

3. Prepare the filling:
   - Pulse in food processor until very finely chopped (not paste-like):
     * Mushrooms
     * Kale
     * Rosemary
     * Garlic
     * Onion
   - Heat remaining 3 tablespoons oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
   - Cook mushroom mixture 10-12 minutes until tender and beginning to brown.
   - Season with salt and pepper.
   - Add wine and scrape up brown bits.
   - Cook until liquid evaporates.
   - Add rice and 1 cup water.
   - Cook until water evaporates.
   - Season with salt and pepper.

4. Finish and bake:
   - Divide filling among squash halves.
   - Mound filling into cavities.
   - Top with divided Gruyere.
   - Bake about 10 minutes until cheese is melted and browned in spots.

recipes.name: Pot Roast
ingredients: 1 (4 to 5-pound) prime boneless beef chuck roast, tied
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 cups chopped leeks, white and light green parts (2 to 4 leeks)
5 large garlic cloves, peeled and crushed
2 cups good red wine, such as Burgundy
1 (28-ounce) can whole plum tomatoes in puree
1 tablespoon unsalted butter, at room temperature
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the oven and meat:
   - Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
   - Pat beef dry with paper towel.
   - Season with 1 tablespoon salt and 1 1/2 teaspoons pepper.
   - Dredge entire roast in flour.

2. Sear the meat:
   - Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in Dutch oven over medium heat.
   - Sear roast 4-5 minutes per side until browned.
   - Sear ends 4-5 minutes each.
   - Remove roast to plate.

3. Cook the vegetables:
   - Add 2 tablespoons olive oil to Dutch oven.
   - Add carrots, onions, celery, leeks, garlic.
   - Season with 1 tablespoon salt and 1 1/2 teaspoons pepper.
   - Cook 10-15 minutes until tender but not browned.

4. Build the sauce:
   - Add wine and Cognac; bring to boil.
   - Add tomatoes, chicken stock, bouillon cube.
   - Add 2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper.
   - Tie thyme and rosemary together; add to pot.

5. Braise the roast:
   - Return roast to pot; bring to boil.
   - Cover and place in oven for 2 1/2 hours.
   - Cook until meat is fork tender (160 degrees F internal).
   - Reduce oven to 250 degrees F after first hour.

6. Finish the sauce:
   - Remove roast to cutting board.
   - Discard herb bundle.
   - Skim fat from sauce.
   - Puree half the sauce and vegetables until smooth.
   - Return puree to pot; simmer over low heat.
   - Mash 2 tablespoons flour with butter.
   - Stir into sauce; simmer 2 minutes until thickened.
   - Season to taste.

7. Serve:
   - Remove strings from roast.
   - Slice meat.
   - Serve warm with sauce spooned over.

recipes.name: Braised Short Ribs
ingredients: 1 large Spanish onion, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
2 carrots, peeled, cut in 1/2 lengthwise, then cut into 1/2-inch pieces
1 bunch fresh thyme, tied with kitchen string
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare and brown the meat:
   - Season short ribs generously with salt.
   - Coat large pot with olive oil; heat to high.
   - Brown ribs 2-3 minutes per side until very well browned.
   - Work in batches if needed to avoid overcrowding.

2. Prepare oven and vegetables:
   - Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
   - Puree vegetables and garlic in food processor to coarse paste.

3. Cook the vegetable base:
   - Remove browned ribs from pot.
   - Drain fat and coat bottom with fresh oil.
   - Add pureed vegetables; season generously with salt.
   - Brown until very dark and crud forms (5-7 minutes).
   - Scrape crud and let reform; scrape again.

4. Build the sauce:
   - Add tomato paste; brown 4-5 minutes.
   - Add wine and scrape bottom of pan.
   - Lower heat if needed to prevent burning.
   - Reduce mixture by half.

5. Braise:
   - Return short ribs to pan.
   - Add water until meat is just covered (about 2 cups).
   - Add thyme bundle and bay leaves.
   - Cover and place in oven for 3 hours.
   - Check periodically; add water if needed.
   - Turn ribs halfway through cooking.

6. Finish:
   - Remove lid for final 20 minutes to brown and reduce sauce.
   - Meat should be very tender but not falling apart.
   - Serve with braising liquid.

recipes.name: Dad's Meatloaf with Tomato Relish
ingredients: 2 red bell peppers, cored, seeded, and finely diced
2 tomatoes, halved, seeded, and finely diced
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
3 slices white bread, crusts removed, torn into chunks
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the oven:
   - Preheat to 350 degrees F.

2. Make the tomato relish:
   - Heat 2 counts of oil in skillet over medium heat.
   - Saute onion, garlic, and bay leaves until fragrant.
   - Add red peppers; cook until softened.
   - Add tomatoes, keeping them intact.
   - Stir in parsley, ketchup, and Worcestershire.
   - Season with salt and pepper.
   - Simmer 5 minutes.
   - Remove from heat (should yield about 4 cups).

3. Prepare the bread mixture:
   - Place torn bread in bowl.
   - Add milk to barely cover.
   - Swish bread in milk; let soak.

4. Make the meatloaf mixture:
   - In large bowl combine:
     * Ground beef and pork
     * 1 1/2 cups tomato relish
     * Eggs
     * Thyme
     * Salt and pepper
   - Squeeze excess milk from bread; add to mixture.
   - Test seasoning by cooking small patty.

5. Form and top the meatloaf:
   - Oil a cookie sheet.
   - Form meat mixture into 9x4-inch log.
   - Top with 1/2 cup tomato relish.
   - Lay bacon slices lengthwise across top.

6. Bake and serve:
   - Bake 1 to 1 1/2 hours until bacon is crisp and meatloaf is firm.
   - Rotate occasionally for even bacon browning.
   - Let cool slightly before slicing.
   - Serve with remaining tomato relish.
recipes.image: recipe images/Dad's Meatloaf with Tomato Relish.jpg

recipes.name: Maple Bacon Double Cheeseburgers
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the patties:
   - Form beef into 12 thin patties, about 4 1/2 inches wide.
   - Place on baking sheet.
   - Refrigerate at least 30 minutes to firm.

2. Prepare grill and cook bacon:
   - Preheat grill to high; lightly oil grates.
   - Place bacon in large nonstick skillet (overlapping ok).
   - Cook over medium heat until browned and crisp, 15-20 minutes.
   - Remove bacon to plate.
   - Reserve drippings in bowl.

3. Glaze the bacon:
   - Return bacon to skillet in single layer.
   - Drizzle with maple syrup.
   - Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon pepper.
   - Cook over medium heat until glazed, about 1 minute.
   - Remove to plate to cool.

4. Prepare buns and sauce:
   - Brush cut sides of buns with bacon drippings.
   - Mix in small bowl:
     * Mayonnaise
     * Ketchup
     * Mustard
     * Hot sauce

5. Cook the burgers:
   - Season patties with salt and pepper on both sides.
   - Grill in batches until marked on bottom, 2 minutes.
   - Flip and top each with cheese slice.
   - Cover and cook 30 seconds more for medium.
   - Toast buns on grill.

6. Assemble:
   - Spread mayonnaise sauce on buns.
   - Layer with:
     * Pickle chips
     * Two patties per burger
     * Glazed bacon

recipes.name: Brown Sugar Skirt Steak with Succotash
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 pound skirt steak, trimmed and cut into 4 portions
2 medium red tomatoes (about 1 pound), cut into 1/2-inch-thick wedges
2 tablespoons olive oil, plus more for oiling the grill grates
1 large red onion (about 8 ounces), sliced into 1/2-inch rounds
One 15-ounce can black-eyed peas, drained and rinsed
1/2 cup roughly chopped fresh parsley or cilantro
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the steak:
   - Prepare grill or grill pan for medium-high heat.
   - Mix brown sugar, 1 tablespoon salt and 2 teaspoons pepper.
   - Rub mixture into steaks.
   - Let sit 15 minutes.

2. Prepare vegetables and sauce:
   - Season tomatoes with salt and pepper in large bowl.
   - Make sauce by whisking together:
     * Sour cream
     * Cumin
     * Lime zest and juice
     * Pinch of salt and pepper
   - Set sauce aside.

3. Grill vegetables:
   - Oil grill grates.
   - Brush corn and onions with oil.
   - Season with salt and pepper.
   - Grill until lightly charred, 6-8 minutes.
   - Turn occasionally.
   - Transfer to cutting board to cool.

4. Cook the steak:
   - Grill steaks about 4 minutes per side for medium rare.
   - Rest for 5 minutes.

5. Prepare succotash:
   - Cut corn from cobs.
   - Quarter onion rounds.
   - Combine in bowl with tomatoes:
     * Corn
     * Onions
     * Black-eyed peas
     * Half the parsley
   - Season with salt and pepper.

6. Serve:
   - Slice steaks across the grain.
   - Divide among 4 plates.
   - Add succotash portion to each plate.
   - Top with dollop of sour cream mixture.
   - Garnish with remaining parsley.
   - Serve immediately.
recipes.image: recipe images/Brown Sugar Skirt Steak with Succotash.jpeg

recipes.name: Braised Lamb Tacos
ingredients: 1 5-pound bone-in leg of lamb, cross-cut into 5 to 6 pieces
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
2 12-ounce bottles lager beer (Great Lakes Dortmunder Gold recommended)
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the marinade:
   - Toast cumin and coriander seeds in a small skillet over medium heat
   - Swirl pan until seeds are slightly darkened, about 2 minutes
   - Transfer toasted seeds to a large bowl
   - Add to bowl and whisk to combine:
     * Sherry vinegar
     * Olive oil
     * Smashed garlic
     * Red pepper flakes
     * Cinnamon stick
     * Brown sugar
     * Ancho chile powder
     * Crushed tomatoes

2. Marinate the lamb:
   - Place lamb in a large nonreactive container
   - Pour marinade over lamb
   - Cover and refrigerate overnight (or up to 48 hours)

3. Prepare for cooking:
   - Preheat oven to 350°F
   - Remove lamb from marinade; pat dry
   - Reserve the marinade
   - Season lamb with salt and pepper

4. Brown the meat:
   - Heat canola oil in large Dutch oven over medium-high heat
   - Working in batches, brown lamb 3-4 minutes per side

5. Braise:
   - Add reserved marinade to pot
   - Add beer and jalapeno
   - Bring to a simmer
   - Cover and transfer to oven
   - Braise until very tender, about 2 hours

6. Finish and serve:
   - Remove from oven and let cool slightly
   - Skim off excess fat
   - Remove lamb and pull meat off bones
   - Discard bones and fat
   - Strain liquid into smaller pot and keep warm
   - Shred meat with fingers
   - Pour warmed braising liquid over meat
   - Toss to coat
   - Serve in warmed corn tortillas
   - Top with fresh cilantro

recipes.name: Grilled Potato Salad with Bacon Vinaigrette
ingredients: 1 pound mini Yukon gold potatoes, halved
2 tablespoons roughly chopped flat leaf parsley
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare the bacon dressing:
   - Cook bacon in large nonstick skillet over medium heat
   - Cook until golden brown and crispy, 10-12 minutes
   - Transfer bacon to paper towel-lined plate
   - Transfer bacon fat to small mixing bowl
   - Add to warm bacon fat and whisk to combine:
     * Whole-grain mustard
     * Brown sugar
     * Sherry vinegar
     * Juice from half lemon
   - Season with black pepper
   - Keep warm

2. Prepare the grill:
   - Preheat grill over medium heat

3. Steam the potatoes:
   - Place halved potatoes in microwave-safe baking dish
   - Add 1/4 cup water
   - Cover tightly with plastic wrap
   - Microwave on high until slightly tender, about 3 minutes
   - Remove and discard remaining water

4. Season vegetables:
   - Combine in large mixing bowl:
     * Steamed potatoes
     * Whole scallions
     * Olive oil
     * Kosher salt
     * Black pepper
   - Toss to coat evenly

5. Grill vegetables:
   - Place potatoes cut-side down on grill
   - Grill until tender and caramelized, 7 minutes per side
   - Place scallions on coolest area of grill
   - Grill scallions 1-2 minutes per side, watching carefully
   - Remove vegetables from grill

6. Assemble the salad:
   - Cut grilled scallions into 1-inch pieces
   - Place in bowl with grilled potatoes
   - Crumble cooked bacon into bowl
   - Add chopped parsley
   - Season with flaky sea salt
   - Drizzle generously with warm bacon dressing
   - Toss to coat evenly
recipes.image: recipe images/Grilled Potato Salad with Bacon Vinaigrette.jpeg

recipes.name: Hanger Steak Tacos with Chile and Herb Oils
ingredients: 1 cup vegetable oil, plus more for the pan
1 cup lightly packed fresh cilantro sprigs, plus additional leaves for garnish
1/2 cup lightly packed fresh parsley leaves
About 1/4 cup Mexican crema or sour cream
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare marinade:
   - Bring medium saucepan of water to boil
   - In large bowl combine:
     * Juice from half orange
     * Juice from half lime
     * Ground coriander
     * Ground cumin
     * 1/2 teaspoon ancho powder
     * 1 teaspoon salt
   - Poke steak all over with fork
   - Add to marinade and coat well
   - Marinate at room temperature for 15 minutes

2. Prepare pickled onions:
   - Combine in microwave-safe bowl:
     * Remaining orange and lime juices
     * Apple cider vinegar
     * Sugar
     * 1/4 teaspoon salt
     * 2 tablespoons water
   - Microwave until simmering, about 45 seconds
   - Add sliced red onion
   - Let stand, tossing occasionally

3. Make chile oil:
   - In small saucepan combine:
     * Paprika
     * 1/2 cup vegetable oil
     * Remaining 1/2 teaspoon ancho powder
   - Heat just below simmer over medium-low heat
   - Cook until oil is hot and bright red, about 3 minutes
   - Transfer to small bowl

4. Make herb oil:
   - Prepare bowl of ice water
   - Add cilantro and parsley to boiling water
   - Cook until bright green and wilted, about 20 seconds
   - Transfer herbs to ice bath
   - Squeeze out excess water from herbs
   - Blend herbs with remaining 1/2 cup oil until smooth
   - Strain through fine-meshed sieve into bowl

5. Cook the steak:
   - Heat oil in large cast-iron pan over medium-high heat
   - Remove steak from marinade and pat dry
   - Cook 5-6 minutes per side for medium rare
   - Rest for 5 minutes
   - Slice thinly across grain
   - Season with additional salt

6. Assemble tacos:
   - Drizzle plates with crema, chile oil, and herb oil
   - Make 3 tacos per person using:
     * Warmed corn tortillas
     * Sliced steak
     * Pickled onions
     * Avocado slices
     * Fresh cilantro
     * Drizzle of crema
     * Drizzle of chile and herb oils
recipes.image: recipe images/Hanger Steak Tacos with Chile and Herb Oils.jpg

recipes.name: Fajita Steak Salad with Cilantro-Lime Vinaigrette
ingredients: 2 pounds top round London broil steak
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves, finely chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
3 small red onions, roots intact and halved
recipes.instructions:
For the steak: Set a large resealable plastic bag in a medium saucepan and pull the edges of the bag over the sides of the pan for easy access to the bag. Add the vegetable oil, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, oregano, paprika, lemon juice, garlic, scallion, 1 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon pepper to the bag and whisk to combine. Add the London broil and seal the bag tightly. Remove the bag from the pan and use your hands to rotate the meat, coating thoroughly in the marinade. Lay the bag flat on a cutting board and marinate at room temperature for 1 hour, flipping the bag after 30 minutes. (The seasoned meat can also be stored in the refrigerator overnight. Let rest at room temperature for 20 minutes before cooking.)

Remove the steak from the bag and discard any stuck-on garlic cloves and scallion. Set a grill pan over high heat until just starting to smoke, about 3 minutes. (Or prepare a grill for high heat.) Lightly oil the pan. Place the steak in the center of the pan and grill until the bottom is nicely charred, about 5 minutes. Flip the steak and continue grilling until an insert-read thermometer inserted sideways into the center of the steak registers between 120 and 125 degrees F, 3 to 5 minutes more. Transfer the steak to the cutting board and rest for 10 minutes.

For the vinaigrette: While the steak rests, whisk the cilantro, olive oil, cumin, lime zest and juice, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper together in a large bowl. Pour half of the vinaigrette into a small bowl and set aside.

For the salad: Add the bell peppers and onions to the large bowl of vinaigrette and toss to thoroughly coat. Arrange the onions cut-side down and the peppers skin--side down on the same grill pan over high heat and grill until deeply charred, about 4 minutes. Transfer to the same cutting board as the steak.

Add the remaining vinaigrette back to the large bowl. Add grated cheese and salad greens and toss to combine. Arrange the salad mixture on a large serving platter. Top with the grilled peppers.

Cut the roots off the onion halves and slice the onions into thin wedges. Arrange on the salad. Thinly slice the rested steak against the grain and arrange in the center of the salad. Arrange the avocado slices around the edge of the platter, then sprinkle tortilla strips over the top of the salad.
recipes.image: recipe images/Fajita Steak Salad with Cilantro-Lime Vinaigrette.jpeg

recipes.name: Chef's Salad with Buttermilk Ranch Dressing
ingredients: 1 large head green leaf lettuce, chopped (8 cups)
2 slices country ham, browned and chopped
3 cups cubed sourdough bread (stale bread is best)
recipes.instructions:
For the Buttermilk Ranch Dressing: Stir together the buttermilk, mayonnaise, sour cream, chives, dill, lemon juice, garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

For the Sourdough Croutons: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Toss the bread cubes, olive oil, Parmesan, Italian seasoning, garlic powder and pepper on large rimmed baking sheet. Bake until the bread begins to brown, 10 minutes. Stir and bake until the croutons are browned and crispy, 5 minutes more. Set aside to cool completely.

To Assemble the Salad: Arrange the lettuce, Sourdough Croutons, tomatoes, Cheddar, carrots, cucumbers, onion, eggs and ham on a serving platter. Drizzle with desired amount of buttermilk ranch dressing.

Cook's Note: A Y-peeler for julienne cutting works well for prepping the vegetables. To brown the country ham, heat 1 tablespoon canola or vegetable oil in a large skillet. Brown 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Remove to paper towels to drain.
recipes.image: recipe images/Chef's Salad with Buttermilk Ranch Dressing.jpg

recipes.name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 boneless, skinless chicken breast, about 12 ounces
One 1-inch piece ginger, peeled and cut into matchsticks
4 ounces shiitake or button mushrooms, stemmed and sliced 1/2 inch thick
1 small carrot, peeled and cut into 3-inch-long matchsticks
3 cups steamed jasmine rice, for serving
recipes.instructions:
1. Place the chicken breast in the freezer until firm enough to thinly slice, about 20 minutes. Using a sharp or serrated knife, thinly slice the chicken 1/8 inch thick. Transfer to a medium bowl and drizzle in 1 tablespoon of the soy sauce. Let sit for 10 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil and 1 tablespoon of the cornstarch and mix well. Set aside in a cool place for 20 minutes.

2. Whisk the remaining 2 teaspoons cornstarch with 2 teaspoons water in a small bowl; set aside.

3. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a wok or large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. When the oil starts to shimmer, add the chicken slices in an even layer and cook, undisturbed, until they just turn opaque, about 45 seconds. Flip and cook, undisturbed, until almost entirely opaque, 45 seconds to 1 minute. Remove to a bowl.

4. Add the ginger and garlic to the wok. Cook, stirring often, until the garlic is slightly golden brown, about 30 seconds. Add the broccoli and toss to coat; cook, stirring occasionally, for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and carrot; toss to combine. Add the Shaoxing wine and cook, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom. Add the chicken stock, white pepper if using, chicken and the remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce.

5. Mix the cornstarch mixture in the bowl until well combined then add to the wok. Stir until everything is nicely coated, reduce the heat to medium low and cover with a lid. Cook until the sauce has thickened slightly and the chicken is cooked through, about 2 minutes. Drizzle with the sesame oil. Toss until everything is well combined and transfer to a serving platter. Enjoy warm with steamed rice on the side.

recipes.name: Caramel Chicken
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
recipes.instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.

2. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the brown sugar and cook, stirring constantly, until it begins to melt, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook, continuing to stir, for another 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the vinegar, fish sauce and soy sauce. Bring to a low simmer and let cook for about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat.

3. Use a paper towel to thoroughly pat dry the chicken. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper.

4. Heat a large ovenproof skillet over high heat until very hot. Add the oil. Place the chicken in the skillet skin-side down and let brown without moving it for about 4 minutes.
